column1: Poronaysk (Russian: Порона́йск; Japanese: 敷香町 Shikuka-chō; Ainu: Sistukari or Sisi Tukari) is a town and the administrative center of Poronaysky District of Sakhalin Oblast
column3: located on the Poronay River 288 kilometers (179 mi) north of Yuzhno-Sakhalinsk. Population: 16

column1: It was founded in 1869 as a Russian outpost Tikhmenevsky near the Nivkh and Ainu settlements in the area. The Treaty of Portsmouth transferred it to Japanese control along with the rest of the southern half of the island of Sakhalin. It was renamed Shikuka (敷香町
column3: remaining under Japanese control until the Soviet Army retook the whole of the island in 1945.

column1: After the town had been granted to the Soviet Union
column3: after the river on which it stands. The river's name is from Ainu poro nay
column6: or growing river." Various Japanese place name Horonai (幌内) share the same etymology with Poronaysk.

column1: Within the framework of administrative divisions
column2: Poronaysk serves as the administrative center of Poronaysky District and is subordinated to it. As a municipal division
column5: and eleven rural localities of Poronaysky District are incorporated as Poronaysky Urban Okrug.

column2: as well as timber and fishing industries. Sakhalinskaya GRES power station is supplied with coal from an open cut mine close to the town.

column1: The town lies on the island's railway network
column2: as well as on the main highway connecting Yuzhno-Sakhalinsk with Alexandrovsk-Sakhalinsky.
owing to the cold Sea of Okhotsk surrounding the town
column3: has a subarctic climate (Dfc) with short
column4: mild and very foggy summers and very cold winters.
